name: Pear Smoothie With Spinach, Celery and Ginger
description: This began as a “clean out the refrigerator and (aging) fruit bowl” smoothie.  I salvaged some spinach that had seen better days and finally used up the last of the pears I’d bought a few weeks ago for another set of recipe tests. I went out to my garden and grabbed some bolting arugula and some mint. I’ve been drinking  kefir, a fermented milk product much like yogurt but thinner and tangier, so that went in, giving the smoothie  a pleasantly  acidic edge. The two ingredients that the drink needs in order for it to taste like something other than a bland green drink are the half banana and the ginger. If you let your bananas ripen completely, then freeze them, they’ll contribute not only flavor, sweetness and texture but also ice to your smoothies.
keywords: fall, spring, summer, winter, halal, high fiber, kosher, low cholesterol, low-fat, nut-free, vegetarian
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup washed spinach leaves (baby or bunch)
1 ripe pear, peeled, quartered, cored and cut in chunks
1/2 banana (50 g), frozen if possible, sliced

recipeInstructions.text: Place all of the ingredients in a blender and blend at high speed for 1 minute, or until smooth. Serve at once.
